newsitem.title: SPAIN: Council Europe sets 200 bln pta matador programme.
newsitem.headline: Council Europe sets 200 bln pta matador programme.

text.p: The Social Development Fund of the Council of Europe presented on Wednesday a programme for the launch of up to 200 billion pesetas in Matador bonds, Council of Europe and Santander de Negocios acting as lead manager announced.
The programme, which starts today, includes the issuance of maturities from one-year to 30-year, at fixed and floating rates.
The bonds to be issued will have the option to be redenominated in euro.
"We know to keep ourselves flexible, with the possibility to offer issuances also to small groups of investors, even to a single one," said Thiery Porel, financial director of the Council of Europe.
The Council of Europe launched five Matador bonds in 1996, three of which were used to finance projects inside the country.
The Social Development Fund of the Council of Europe has a rating of AAA from Standard and Poor's, Aa1 from Moody's and AAA from IBCA.
